alert.note: Alert for Meriwether (Georgia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 14 at 2:23PM EDT by NWS Atlanta
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southern Meriwether, northwestern Talbot and northeastern Harris Counties through 300 PM EDT... At 223 PM EDT, a strong thunderstorm was over Harris City, or near Greenville, moving west at 15 mph. HAZARD...40 to 50 mph wind, up to penny sized hail and frequent cloud to ground lightning. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Expect minor damage to tree limbs and blowing around of light, unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Manchester, Pine Mountain, Woodbury, Warm Springs, Woodland, F.d. Roosevelt State Park, Raleigh, Durand, Harris City and Flint Hill. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: People outdoors should seek shelter immediately. If you can hear thunder, you are close enough to be struck by lightning. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 800 PM EDT for west central Georgia.
